page.title: 12CONSERVATION.
page.content: On the Cadland Estate conservation has been given quite a high priority. Work that is going on includes:- 1.{Gravel Extraction.}Gravel extracted in Blackfield is used for making paths and concrete. Where gravel has been extracted there is a programme of restoration including the creation of new footpaths and bridleways. 2.{Forestry.}Amenity woodland,mainly hardwood,has been planted to improve the estate E.G. the belt of Ash trees planted to screen the Fawley by pass. There are several plantations of Scots Pine & Western Hemlock which are used for fencing and coastal defences. 3.{Nature Reserve.}The southern part of our survey area is designated as an area of outstanding natural beauty.The estate looks after the reserve in conjunction with the warden of the North Solent National Nature Reserve.
